com.yantra.api.omp.payment

Interface manageChargeTransactionRequest

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.OMPApi, YIFApi

    public interface manageChargeTransactionRequest

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document manageChargeTransactionRequest(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The manageChargeTransactionRequest API manages Charge Transaction Requests associated to an order.

    • Method Detail

      • manageChargeTransactionRequest

        org.w3c.dom.Document manageChargeTransactionRequest(YFSEnvironment env,
                                                    org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                             throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                                    java.rmi.RemoteException

        The manageChargeTransactionRequest API manages Charge Transaction Requests associated to an order. The API does not map the Requests to Charge Transactions, but seeds data for requestCollection to process.

        The API takes a list of ChargeTransactionRequests in the context of a single order as its input; ChargeTransactionRequests cannot be modified on multiple orders in the same API call. Removing a ChargeTransactionRequest will also delete the mappings to any existing Charge Transaction, which requestCollection can map to a new request. Every time the manageChargeTransactionRequest API is invoked, the Order will be made available for the PAYMENT_COLLECTION agent to pick up and process.

        When using manageChargeTransactionRequest to create ChargeTransactionRequests, these requests should be updated whenever they are based on changes. For example, if the business process is to create a Charge Transaction Request for each release, if a release has a line canceled then the request that represents it should have its MaxRequestAmount reduced to the new total.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits:
        None

        Events Raised: None

        Template Support: Yes

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains details of the modified list of Charge Transaction Requests. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.
        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException
